articles.title: Quantum computing gears up for its 'ChatGPT Moment' — and a potential talent shortage
articles.summary: Quantum computing companies are investing heavily in training programs to avoid a talent shortage like the one AI companies are trying to navigate. The talent pool in the quantum industry is a fraction of the size of the AI field, but demand is growing. IBM, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Google are interested in the field. It is expected to create 250,000 new jobs by 2030 and 840,000 by 2035.

articles.title: Majority of Americans trust what's online less than ever before: poll
articles.author: SWNS
articles.summary: The average American trusts less than half of what they see and read online, according to new research. The survey of 2,000 U.S. adults found that skepticism is at an all-time high when it comes to the internet. 78% agree that the internet has 'never been worse' in terms of differentiating between what's real and what's artificial. 80% of Americans rely on reviews when choosing a business to support.

articles.title: 7 AI Chatbots Predict a Bullish End to 2025 for Bitcoin
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: Back in February, our publication deployed an array of generative artificial intelligence. It was a response to a request from the publication's readers. It used a combination of artificial intelligence and human-like intelligence. The results were quite effective and useful.

articles.title: Rockets to introduce ‘ClutchBot' as generative artificial intelligence mascot
articles.summary: The Houston Rockets and Theta Labs are developing a new AI-powered mascot called 'ClutchBot'. It will be unveiled for the start of the 2025-26 season this fall. It will provide real-time information about upcoming games, tickets, lineups, stats, stats and venue information.

articles.title: Posted Apr 26, 2025 at 5:41 PM EDT
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Double-tapping the Google Photos search icon brings back classic search. The shortcut only works on Android. Ask Photos uses AI to understand your pictures and enables search terms like 'What did we eat at the hotel in Stanley?' but it's rather slow in operation compared to 'classic' search.

articles.title: AI Agents Haven't Taken Over DeFi (Yet)
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI agents don't just need intelligence, they need DeFi-ready infrastructure. It's only a matter of time when most transactions will be run by AI agents, not just by humans.    - John Defterios, CEO of Defterio.

articles.title: PA House Committee Advances Resolution to Address AI Impact on Creative Workers
articles.author: Maryann Pugh
articles.summary: The Pennsylvania House Communications & Technology Committee unanimously approved a resolution that urges Congress to protect creative sector workers from the growing threat of displacement by artificial intelligence. The resolution was introduced by state Rep. Kristine Howard, D-Chester. It calls for amendments to U.S. copyright law clarifying that machine-generated works cannot be copyrighted. It also seeks to combat practices such as 'data scraping' where copyrighted materials are used to train AI programs without the consent of original creators.

articles.title: AI: How to use it in education
articles.author: palenoue
articles.summary: AI is a revolution in the world of thought in the past century. It's time to talk about what all this means for university life and humanities in particular.    The approach appears to be: "We'll just tell the kids they can't use these tools and carry on as before".

The most under-appreciated application of AI is healthcare, as AI will accelerate the curing of diseases. Generative AI, which 'creates customized answers for the user based on the underlying data,' is currently a hot area within the AI sector. AI is being used to analyze genomic data to identify individuals at high risk for certain cancers and for personalized medicine, drug finding, and disease prevention

When a user comes close to an obstacle, a prompt is sent through bone conduction.

articles.title: Stark County teen saw Ohio had no regulation of AI and health care. So she wrote a bill
articles.author: Elizabeth B. Kim
articles.summary: Paisley Tuel, 19, is a pre-law student at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland. She and Sabrina Soto, co-editor-in-chief of the CWRU Law Journal, wrote a 50-page paper about the need for AI-specific regulations in health care in Ohio. They presented their findings to Allison Russo, the minority leader of the Ohio House of Representatives. She invited them to help draft a house bill on the topic. If enacted, the bill would establish the Ohio AI Healthcare Regulatory Committee to oversee the use of AI in healthcare.

articles.title: AI understands many things except for human social interactions
articles.author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence excels at recognizing objects or faces in still images, but it struggles to grasp the complexity of human interactions, according to a recent American study. The study was published in the journal "Artificial Intelligence: The Future of the AI" by Andrew Keen.

articles.title: Should we start taking the welfare of AI seriously?
articles.summary: Anthropic, the AI company that made the Claude chatbot, is studying "model welfare" to see if AI models might become conscious and deserve some kind of moral status. Anthropic hired its first AI welfare researcher, Kyle Fish, a vegan, last year.

articles.title: How IDF's Unit 8200 leverages AI to enhance targeted strikes, locate hostages
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: Israel's Unit 8200 has integrated AI technology for facial recognition, audio analysis, and Arabic. It uses facial recognition and audio analysis technology. It is based on AI technology developed by Israel's unit 8200.   Â   for AI technology.

articles.title: MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell's legal team accused of submitting inaccurate, AI-generated brief to Colorado court
articles.author: Ashley Michels
articles.summary: A federal judge in Colorado ordered Mike Lindell and his legal team to explain themselves to a federal judge after she found about 30 defective citations in a brief they submitted. The brief was generated by artificial intelligence. Lindell's legal team admits to using AI, but denies it was a mistake.

articles.title: Thread by @Aeriumcius on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Armielyn Obinguar explains how to test the reasoning ability of ChatGPT or any LLM. It's not grammar but thoughtful reasoning that is the most important test of an LLM's brain. It tests the model's ability to evaluate conflicting or logically flawed statements and its self-awareness.

articles.title: Environmental journalists: Readers are losers in the AI revolution
articles.author: Serenity Reynolds
articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence is making it harder for journalists to convey complicated science news about the environment. Panayiotis Moutis, a professor of the City College of New York, said readers stand to lose the most from AI. Jay Barchas-Lichtenstein, senior research manager for the global Center for News, Technology and Innovation, said the winners of the AI revolution are software developers and powerful companies.

articles.title: We Now Know How AI ‘Thinks'—and It's Barely Thinking at All
articles.author: Christopher Mims
articles.summary: Today's AI models simulate intelligence by learning an enormous number of rules of thumb, which they selectively apply to all the information they encounter. The work of these researchers suggests there's something limiting about the underlying architecture of the AI models today.   .

articles.title: We Now Know How AI ‘Thinks'—and It's Barely Thinking at All
articles.author: Christopher Mims
articles.summary: Today's AI models simulate intelligence by learning an enormous number of rules of thumb. This contrasts with the many ways that humans and even animals are able to reason about the world, and predict the future. New techniques for probing large language models show researchers the way these AIs learn to play games or navigate through environments.

articles.title: The Ultimate Control Drama: AI 'Model Welfare'? They're not kidding.

The current version costs around $150,000 and is targeted mainly at businesses, but XPENG plans to develop more accessible versions for everyday consumers.

articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton is a Nobel laureate in physics and the 'godfather of AI'. He believes there's a one in five chance that humanity will eventually be taken over by artificial intelligence. He made the prediction in an interview with CBS News aired on April 1.

articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Scam artists are using AI to cook up headshots and write fake résumés and sites to fit the specifics of a given job opening. Sometimes, those AI scammers end up a little bit violated, because security experts are the security experts. The job market is getting worse.

articles.author: Baltimore Sun

articles.summary: China's President Xi Jinping has called for the country to become more independent in artificial intelligence (AI) at a Politburo meeting on Friday. He emphasized the need for China to achieve 'self-reliance' in the AI industry.

articles.title: Academia tries to keep up with fast-evolving AI trends
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence was introduced as a Class 9 subject by the CBSE board in 2019. This was three years before ChatGPT was launched. In the intervening years, the board sought to further embed AI studies in the curriculum by introducing it as a class 9 subject.

articles.title: How AI Is Rewriting The Future Of Aging
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI is transforming longevity science, from digital twins to smart drug discovery. It's changing how we understand, measure, and personalize aging. It is also accelerating how we measure, measure and personalise aging. For more information, visit: www.longevity-science.org.

articles.title: AI won't replace doctors — it will upgrade them
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: Bill Gates predicted that artificial intelligence will be as good as any doctor within the next decade. We are at a turning point in healthcare. AI holds enormous potential, but the way we talk about it is reckless.       .  .

articles.title: AI model for thyroid cancer diagnosis, with over 90% accuracy and reduced consultation preparation time
articles.author: Science Daily
articles.summary: An interdisciplinary research team has unveiled the world's first artificial intelligence (AI) model designed to classify both the cancer stage and the risk. It is based on a combination of data from various sources. It can be used to predict the cancer's stage and risk.

He is also the head of the party's general secretary in charge of the central committee.

articles.title: 10-Year-Old Girl Homeschooled by Dad Graduates From College With 2 Degrees
articles.author: Michael Wing
articles.summary: Alisa Perales, 10, is the youngest in history to graduate from Crafton Hills College with a 4.0 grade point average and two associate degrees in mathematics and several sciences. She will major in computer science and wants to work in something related to AI or aerospace. Alisa's dad, Rafael, is an attorney who homeschooled his daughter for the past 10 years.

articles.title: How Data Analytics Acceleration Is Solving AI's Hidden Bottleneck
articles.author: Kolawole Samuel Adebayo
articles.summary: NeuroBlade's Analytics Accelerator is a new type of hardware specifically designed to accelerate data analytics. It's being developed by Elad Sity, CEO and cofounder of the Israeli semiconductor startup Sity cofounded. The market supports 2 million general-purpose CPU sockets for analytics workloads and is expected to grow to 4-5 million by 2027.

articles.title: Kentucky lawmakers hope to continue the conversation about AI policies
articles.author: MCKENNA HORSLEY
articles.summary: The panel was held Thursday evening on the University of Kentucky campus. It discussed the opportunities to use artificial intelligence in Kentucky, particularly in areas of workforce development. The General Assembly passed initial legislation to regulate AI in state government with Senate Bill 4 earlier this year. It was signed by Democratic Gov. Andy Beshear in March.

articles.title: AI has no stake in relaying accurate information to readers
articles.author: Christina Myer
articles.summary: West Virginia University journalism students presented their research on the use of artificial intelligence to a room full of seasoned newspaper people this past week. They found out that AI is still a mess and can't replace journalists. There is no replacement for having a human reporter who knows the people and issues in the area.

articles.title: Reporter's Notebook: Trusting a strange computer
articles.author: Christina Myer
articles.summary: West Virginia University journalism students presented their research on the use of artificial intelligence to a room full of seasoned newspaper people. Christina Myer learned a lot from their research. She is executive editor of The Parkersburg News and Sentinel. She believes AI will not replace journalists any time soon.

articles.title: Chatbots can hide secret messages in seemingly normal conversations
articles.author: New Scientist
articles.summary: Text-generating AIs such as ChatGPTT can be used to hide encrypted messages inside fake conversations. It could help people living under oppressive regimes communicate secretly, as well as people living in war-torn countries, as discussed in this article.

articles.summary: Adobe's new Firefly Image Model 4 matches ChatGPT's image generator to create a new image generator. The new model is available for pre-order on Adobe's website now. It's available in black and white and comes with a built-in photo editor.

articles.author: system
articles.summary: Anthropic and Google DeepMind researchers are questioning whether AI models could one day be conscious. Google fired an engineer who claimed AI was "sentient" three years ago, because he said it was too advanced for humans to understand.    .

articles.title: Can AI make my life easier? I spent a week living and working with chatbots to find out
articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence wrote the article, despite several attempts with different models. The end result was peppy, relentlessly positive and not good. For all our fears about AI taking over, this article is a good example of how AI can be used for good.

articles.title: Trump administration pushes EU to call off its AI code of practice
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Donald Trump's administration wants European officials to call off the AI regulation. The regulation would require developers of advanced artificial intelligence to meet stricter conditions on transparency, risk management, and copyright protections. In the past few weeks, the U.S. administration has been pushing for the regulation to be scrapped.

articles.title: Dubai Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan launches new AI academy

articles.title: We Now Know How AI ‘Thinks'—and It's Barely Thinking at All
articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence models can memorize endless lists of rules. That's useful, but not how humans solve problems, as it's not useful for humans either.    for humans, it's useful for them to solve problems on their own.  for artificial intelligence models it's more useful to think.

articles.title: "A big coup": OpenAI's open to buying Google Chrome
articles.author: Newstalk ZB
articles.summary: OpenAI would be open to buying Google's Chrome browser. The DOJ ruled last year that Google is a monopolist in Search and now it's up to OpenAI to decide what to do with Chrome. OpenAI wants to create ChatGPT instead of Google search results.

articles.title: Shocking Green Card Denial for OpenAI Researcher Highlights US Immigration Challenges

articles.summary: In the fast-evolving world of AI, talent is everything. A recent development involving an OpenAI researcher has sent ripples through the community. It highlights significant hurdles in the development of AI technology and the movement of skilled individuals is a critical factor.

articles.title: New study shows why simulated reasoning AI models don't yet live up to their billing
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: Today's most capable AI models can solve routine math problems with impressive accuracy, but when faced with deeper mathematical proofs, they often fail to do so in competition-level challenges. It's a contradiction at the heart of today's AI models that purport to reason.

articles.title: Thesys introduces generative UI API for building AI apps
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: Thesys has introduced C1 by Thesys, a generative UI API that uses large language models to generate user interfaces on the fly. C1 lets developers turn LLM outputs into dynamic, intelligent user interfaces. It was unveiled on April 18 and is available for general use.
